website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a digital voice recorder with a reputation for long battery life and superior sound quality, this Sony model isn't likely to let you down.
pros: Garners praise for the clear sound it produces, which makes it perfect for use in settings like classrooms with lots of background noise
Functions are easy to use, and files are easy to transfer using the USB port
Build is solid and battery life is excellent
cons: Screen readout is a bit busy and may be difficult for some consumers to read

customer_reviews.title: Erratic display
customer_reviews.text: I orderd this on March 8, 2016. When it arrived, I used it for recording three times (it worked fine). I then took the batteries out and put it away. I put batteries in it today, it powered on, I was able to see to set the time and date. It will record, stop and play, but no more screen display. When I press Menu/Disp, the display goes crazy and then disappears. I know it's been almost three years since purchase, but considering the minimal use (about an hour total), I would not recommend purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: John Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for class!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who's taking Organic Chemistry from a professor whose lectures ramble all over the place. She records his lectures then listens to it again where she can rewind, take detailed notes, and really sort it out. She LOVES it and so do her classmates who have asked that she send them the digital audio file as well. She can save it on her computer, burn it to a CD, listen to it in her car. Perfect for learning a tough subject! The device works great, picks up the audio wonderfully and is small enough to not be intrusive. I am VERY pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: and the sound quality is quite good. The included software was not compatible with my ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this recorder to record lectures for class, and the sound quality is quite good. The included software was not compatible with my computer (Windows 10) so I just use Windows Media Player to listen to my lectures. The menu navigation is not really intuitive and there was basically no instructions or information on how to access different folders. Overall though it is easy to use, reliable, and durable despite being tossed around in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: jjyst5

customer_reviews.title: I didnt use this recorder when it i got it ...
customer_reviews.text: I didnt use this recorder when it i got it.So i lost my return.I put the battery in read the instuction.I could never get anything displayed on the screen.They recorders are suppost to be put there paces,They didnot on this one.So I have to eat my cost of a sony recorder.Another piece of china junk!!!!Very pissed off
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: No builtin slide out USB Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This needs to have an a slide out USB Flash Drive that is built in like the Olympus WS-821 Voice Recorders with 2 GB Built-In-Memory which has a USB direct plug in to your lap top. This sony divice and many of the other newer models require you to have a USB cord that connects the recorder to your laptop which is a total pain to always have the cord to upload recordings to my laptop. other than that it is a good recorder.
customer_reviews.author: K. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Use it to record missed classes!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several months now and am absolutely in love. This thing works SO WELL for so many different types of recordings. I've used it to record things that are far away as well as close up. I've literally used this for several hours and the battery is still at 75%. This thing picks up everything super well and is just wonderful. 100% recommended for anything you need to record! I've also used it to record lectures I've missed in college. It picks up students asking questions and the professor's voice is crystal clear. PERFECTION.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This recorder is great! Lightweight, easy to use, great sound quality. The process of downloading recordings to the computer is as easy as connecting it via USB. The software recognizes there is a new recording and with a click transfers it to the appropriate folder. Play back is easy and amazingly clear through computer speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Sedona

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't hesitate to buy this one again.  Awesome product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Best voice recorder in this price range you will find. Clarity and background noise cancelling are excellent, and you can connect via mini USB directly to a PC without the need for extra software (and came with the USB cord as well), along with the ability to store files on a microSD or M2 card. Very easy navigable menu. For the money, this is the best you will find. I've plugged this into a Windows and a Linux machine and both see it simply as an external storage device which simplifies use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cheshire

customer_reviews.title: Workaround for beeping noises
customer_reviews.text: It would be great if turning the volume all the way down on this thing silenced the "beeps" that sound when you press the buttons. Especially for those of us who want to turn it on for a lecture without bothering the other listeners. My solution? I cut the 3mm jack off an old pair of earbuds and stuck it in the "headphone" jack (not the microphone jack!) to fool the device into silencing the speaker for ALL sounds, including the beeps. Other than that annoyance, I really like this. I feel like the sound is good and it's easy enough to work with the interface.
customer_reviews.author: Draws on Anything

customer_reviews.title: 20:15 eyesight & hard to read
customer_reviews.text: The picture of this item shows a nice crisp view when in fact no matter what lighting conditions are or any angle, I couldn't see the display very well & in fact the information at the top of the screen is nearly impossible to see. I would not recommend this for a person who has sight issues.
customer_reviews.author: RKG

customer_reviews.title: Modern, small, easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I tried two other much more expensive recorders. I returned them because they were obviously old technology. This one is lighter, more up to date and really easy to work with. It works great with Dragon speech to text by just sticking it into the USB connector and it comes with software to make the connection. The most important buttons are prominent and large and the rest is just right. The display is clearly readable. The battery lasts a long time. So far it has not moved on the battery indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Functionality = 5/5, UI = 4/5
customer_reviews.text: As far as a voice memo/playback device I'll give it 5/5. I gave it 4/5 just because of button layout and size. Erasing is a bit of a hassle (three buttons x1 press each), basically takes two hands and there is no 'Erase All'. Really though, this things works great. I mainly got this to transfer the voice files to my PC for use in video editing. A plugged in cam-corder shotgun mic produces great sound that I can DL to my computer then import to the video editor and voila... great sounding voice over. It got a 4 just because of the UI.
customer_reviews.author: JoeCubicle

customer_reviews.title: This voice recorder is easy to use and very compact
customer_reviews.text: This voice recorder is easy to use and very compact. The 4 GB built-in storage provides a decent amount of storage space and the option to use external memory is fantastic. Having a USB port to connect the recorder to the computer along with the included software makes saving the recordings quick and easy. A quick start user guide is included with the recorder. There is no .pdf version of the user manual which is not a big deal, but would be extremely useful to have. The previous model has the same features so that user manual can be used to look up the features not covered by the quick start guide and there is an .html version available.
customer_reviews.author: Mirage

customer_reviews.title: Met or exceeded all expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I bought it as a replacement for an older model--still working perfectly but seemingly incompatible with newer computers & software--so I definitely had expectations, and it surpassed all of them. The software is still easy to use and it works with my new laptop, the device itself works similarly to the old one, and the recordings and sound are somewhat better. Admittedly I do not use half the features, but I've had no trouble with the easy-to-use settings. I would not be surprised if it still works great when I replace it in eight or ten years! Great device, great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: easy to use and super sensitive recorder
customer_reviews.text: I love this tape recorder. It is easy to use and the recording ability is awesome. I use it for studying and I have also used it at work to help supplement my notes. It is so sensitive that it can even capture the rustle of papers. One of the great features of this product is the expandable slot that it has for sd cards which is handy for those who need lots of memory. Another special feature is that you can organize your voice recording for various things such as meetings, study notes, etc... into various folders. I love this product and I would recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gizelle

customer_reviews.title: Does everything I want it to do.  Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice, really helpful product. I'm using it to record lectures in class to playback. The app that comes with it is wonderful - I use it to sort recordings and can share via email and text directly from the app. I resisted spending money to get one of these up til now, but I wish I had bought one sooner. It has been very helpful to playback lectures when preparing for exams.
customer_reviews.author: MominSchool

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I got this to record my father's WWII stories before they are gone forever. For the price it is a well made recorder. After playing with the setting I was able to find the right configuration to record while I sit across from him at the dinner table. A little trial and error is all that's needed before it becomes very easy to use both alone and connected to the computer.
customer_reviews.author: JHDK

customer_reviews.title: Sony ICD PX333 Digital Voice Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I give the recorder a 4 star and it would be a 5+star if I would have received COMPLETE instructions with it. Supplier includes start up instructions and you have to go to the internet to get ALL the instructions. If you want to listen to a part of a recording and you hit the back arrows it takes you all the way back to the beginning. I know the instructions would tell me the right way of doing it but to expand my 73 year old brain takes time. I want to read it now and do it. Recorder picks up voices from the other side of the room very well. Very pleased with the recorder.
customer_reviews.author: MtUkeLady

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I just threw this into my E-waste bin. After only 3 months of recording, this unit failed to transfer any files to my computer. After 6 months, it stopped working altogether. A complete waste of money. The Olympus recorder was much better and long-lasting.
customer_reviews.author: bracchki

customer_reviews.title: Incredible background sound distinction
customer_reviews.text: I took this to a meeting in a cafeteria. People were bustling and creating a ton of background noise. I placed the recorder on the table, in the middle of a bunch of napkin holders that I thought would block the sound. I could barely hear the speaking party at the other side of the table the background noise was so loud. I got back to my computer and played the file. All background noise cut by about 60% volume. I could hear the original speaker better than when I was sitting there. Pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: M. Baca

customer_reviews.title: Functionally it's good. My big complaint is that the characters on ...
customer_reviews.text: Functionally it's good. My big complaint is that the characters on the screen are almost invisible in any light except direct sunlight or high intensity lamp shining directly on the screen. I could not even make out the icons, they were so small. There are no instructions to even explain what the icons mean let alone what function they preform. One either has to already be familiar with them or be proficient using another device that is similar. These faults override any positive feelings I have for this device. I am going to find a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Long running on one set of batteries.
customer_reviews.text: The menu is too complex and confusing. So if the default settings are not for you, you must study. I finally figured it out. I raised from 2 stars to 4 stars. It will consistently record for 72+ hours on the lowest setting on one set of two batteries. Sony (one battery) and the rechargeable Trustins get only about 16 hours. For spy work it is great. You can leave it for 3 days running on your porch or in Baskerville's study.
customer_reviews.author: Backyard Bob

customer_reviews.title: Decent recorder
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than I expected. I have not used it extensively; rather, not very often. Pros: I have used it when I need to voice record conversations and lectures I want to review, or hide it in my pocket for more clandestine purposes. Couldn't believe that it actually picked up voices through my suit jacket or pants pocket (though distant during playback). Cons: It is not as user friendly as I would have imagined. No instruction book included. I had to test multiple settings in order to find those that fit my needs. Annoying feature: When you want to delete a recording, the device begins playing the recording until you finalize the deletion.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: wroks wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a couple of years now. I use it to record my class lectures. Replaced the battery once, and great storage capacity (some lectures are 3 hours) It is very reliable, has good noise suppression, very easy to use and installs for download on the computer well. Works just fine from mid classroom (regular classroom, not a lecture hall, no microphone used by professor)
customer_reviews.author: harleyquinharley

customer_reviews.title: I have tried other much cheaper recorders and the money was wasted. The name SONY should tell you a lot
customer_reviews.text: It is pricey at near $50. But it is a fact that you get what you paid for. I use this recorder to record each week's sermon at my church and then put the sermon on the internet. I have tried other much cheaper recorders and the money was wasted. The name SONY should tell you a lot. For power it takes a AAA alkaline or rechargeable. It records in MP3 so you don't have to convert. Audio quality is very good. It fits in your hand so it is easy to handle. Some of these recorders are so small that they are difficult to handle.
customer_reviews.author: NENAD

customer_reviews.title: They all love the quality of the recordings
customer_reviews.text: I use this to record a class and share the recording with friends whose scheduled don't permit them to attend. They all love the quality of the recordings. The device is intuitive to use and offers everything a simple recorder can for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Irving Cantor

customer_reviews.title: great recorder with excellent features
customer_reviews.text: very good product for the price. used it yesterday during HOA meeting and it picked up everyone at the front table very well. also, comes with software that allows you to move files from recorder to your laptop/pc and store recordings in organized folders. very important also is that the software allows for a "transcription" mode so you can work on a recording from your laptop/pc while creating a word document. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: I had an earlier version and it had a more solid feel and the plastic was a better quality. This model is also missing stereo mi
customer_reviews.text: The quality is down with this model. I had an earlier version and it had a more solid feel and the plastic was a better quality. This model is also missing stereo microphones so... now that I founds the older one (I had lost it and bought this one as a replacement), this new one sits in my drawer. It's an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Luv Am A Zon

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent recorder. I'm a journalist and I use it for interviewing people. The sound quality is great, and mp3 files are easily transferred to your computer for transcribing (I *really* recommend Transcribe by Wreally.) Sony has higher-end models, but unless you really need stereo recordings, don't bother. For dictation and recording lectures and interviews, this is all you need. It's the best I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Spatchcock

customer_reviews.title: and its simple design is very easy to navigate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could begin recording interviews with family members to collect family history. I've only played around with the settings based on the instruction manual, and its simple design is very easy to navigate, and the playback is clear for voice pickup. Looking forward to using it for oral histories.
customer_reviews.author: makiki7

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for the kiddies - 7 and 9 yrs. They enjoyed using the voice on my cell phone, so . . maybe these would be fun? Oh, mama! They: make commercials, sing solos and duets, record diaries . . .and other things I don't know about. The units are small - I bought iGadgitz cases for them - kids take them everywhere. As for quality, my husband has used the older version of this Sony model for years in his work. Always reliable with good voice capture.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Moretti

customer_reviews.title: I can see this as a great tool for lectures also
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my husband had a series of meetings with doctors relating to oncology and treatments for cancer. I asked the doctors if I could record our discussions and treatment options. They said "Yes!" They wished more patients did this very thing. I set the recorder on the counter in the exam room and it picked up all the conversations. I can see this as a great tool for lectures also. In my case, I can review what the doctors have said and review treatment plans, there are no questions as to what is said. Even better, I can send an audio file via email! Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Nice recorder
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful recorder that records your voice very well. It is the color black and has different folders to store your recordings in. You have to press the red little circle button to record something and the little white square to stop. Then you can press the enter/play button to play the recording. You press the arrows to the left side of the stop button to fast backward and the one on the right to fast forward. You can press the menu button to change the date and time. This recorder shipped on time and that is why I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pramodini Arramreddy

customer_reviews.title: Best recorder! Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Best recorder! Easy to use, picks up professors from my seat (I usually sit towards the front.) It has the ability to cut extra noise, and had 45 hours of recording! Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: avalf

customer_reviews.title: Great little audio recorder
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this recorder to record cockpit communication for aviation videos I produce. I plug it into the headphone connector with a 1/4" to 3.5mm adapter. I was specifically looking for a recorder that has an option for line-in, which this unit does. The sound quality is excellent. I am very impressed with the battery life and recording capacity. It will hold over 40 hours on the built in memory alone. So far I have recorded over 5 hrs on the same battery. The unit is smaller than I expected and very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: pjeitler

customer_reviews.title: Sony's Voice Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked the Sony Recorder. It has great authentic sound. This is my third purchase of one. Which gives rise to my problem with it: it is too easy to lose. I wish it had a wrist strap attached to it. I am a songwriter and if I lose it, I have lost a huge sum: It can hold over 125 - 400 songs at one time. So one really has to be careful with it.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: voice activated recording
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little recorder. It has mutable functions like voice activated recording, microphone recording, interview, lecture, meeting, and voce notes. You can put the recordings in different folders to keep everything organized. With out added micro SD card the preinstalled 4GB hard drive gives you 43h 55m of record time. If you need to you can add a Micro SD card for extra record time. But what puts this aside of the rest of the voice recorders is that you can connect this to your computer and transfer all the recorded files for later reference. This is a must for every student that is able to record there teachers lecture.
customer_reviews.author: JarHead002

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, computer compatible, and expandable memory
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily at school. It is great and lets you add a memory card to store even more info. I have a 32 GB samsung card and it works perfectly. You can also attach it to your computer to download your recordings, and even add however many files you want. That way, when im in physics, i record to the physics file, when im in Chemistry, the chemistry, so on and so forth. I really enjoy this and the quality is great.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: this one is perfect! It's light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for voice recorder, this one is perfect! It's light and easy to use. I use it at least 3 times a week for lectures. It does great job recording and not expensive. I was comparing this one with the others. I didn't regret buying it. It has a USB port, if you need, you can always transport data from this recorder to your computer. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: any decent smartphone quality is way better.
customer_reviews.text: it's ok but frankly...any decent smartphone quality is way better.
customer_reviews.author: Julia H.

customer_reviews.title: So far it is EXCELLENT and was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine delivered to me today, 12/13/14 (love the date). So far it is EXCELLENT and was very easy to set up. The sound quality is the first thing I noticed and also the quality of the built in speaker. On playback of your files the volume is more than adequate. Haven't really had time to get into all the features of this SONY ICD-PX333 but if I find something that I don't like I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Royal

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This simple little recorder is wonderful. It works great. The sound quality is great. It is a bit tricky to figure out with it's 'simplicity' (especially when you are in a hurry to get a meeting recorded), but it is really a great value. It is very simple to transfer to my computer and transcribe. I love this little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Homemaker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little Recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. I lost the 1st one after over a year of use. I'm using this to record speakers at open talks my homegroup puts on monthly. It works great, picks up lots of stuff, even the nuance in a change in voice pitch...great product. The software that loads onto the desktop is awesome, very simple to edit talks...delete old ones etc...Just read the instructions that come with and watch you tube videos on it if your confused. Sonys Service folks are great too, and patient :)
customer_reviews.author: hikingfoole_85

customer_reviews.title: Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have spent so much money on portable tape recorders only to be dissatisfied. It is a good quality recorder but playback take forever. It is not functional for what I need. I have had stalking problems and am trying to catch "a needle in a haystack". It records fine but then I have to playback 8 hours or more and relisten to what I have recorded. There isn't an easy way to transfer the audio and scrub through it. I am just a basic user. If someone needs a portable recorder, it works fine. For detective work for evidence building, it is not the right one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: A Great Recording Device
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my successor as secretary of an organization--I have had the earlier version and since I was so satisfied with it, I didn't look into any other brands or types. The clarity of the sound is super, I can easily upload the recordings to my computer to keep forever, but the recorder holds so many hours that I have had to delete old recordings to make room for new ones only once or twice in the two years that I have been using it. I record ALL lectures, etc that I attend--it is small, weighs nothing, and is totally reliable.
customer_reviews.author: carolbi

customer_reviews.title: Great for Students
customer_reviews.text: I leave it on in my back back during class, the battery lasts long enough (like 2 days of running because I forgot to turn it off). and the software makes it easy to edit and transfer the sound files. If you are going to leave it in your bag though I recommend pointing the microphone towards the speaker and sitting within 20 feet of them. I haven't tried the voice activation, but placed in the open, it has no problems picking up sound and only needing to use a single recording out of ten still makes a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Xander

customer_reviews.title: Sony ICD PX333 Recorder Works Like A Large Voice Recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is the neatest digital recorder...it will fit in my pocket or my purse. Excellent sound quality and very easy to use. I had another brand but it didn't sound as clear on play-back as this was does. I don't leave home without it...put my grocery list on it, items I need to look for while shopping, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Granny from Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have half a dozen recorders and this is a great one. I bought this one for my Mom, but I've owned the exact same one for a couple of years and it has been the best one of all. It is a little bulkier than the rechargeable ones since it holds AAA batteries, but fits nicely in the hand because of this. Good button, good operating system, easy to understand, didn't need to read manual (but did anyway), good sounds quality.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: great recorder.
customer_reviews.text: I work investigations and record interviews. The sound is great and with the software that comes with it I download it to my computer for storage and forwarding interviews to my supervisor. I would recommend getting a memory chip.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Cornwall

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS THING. BOUGHT IT TO REPLACE THE CHEAP RCA I GOT AT WALMART FOR 30 BUCKS. THE SOFTWARE IS VERY EASY TO USE FOR CUTTING AND IMPORTING AND EXPORTING MUSIC. AND THE BATTERY LASTS FOR EVER. THE SOUND QUALITY IS GREAT I USE IT TO RECORD MY VOICE LESSONS AND MUSIC AND BLOCKING REHEARSAL FOR SHOWS MASSIVE STORAGE.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: It easily picks up voice from multiple people in the meeting
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Records well in a meeting. The reproduction voice is clear and un-distorted. It easily picks up voice from multiple people in the meeting. The small size makes it easy to carry. Cons: 1. The User Interface is HORRIBLE. Takes real effort to learn. Surprising that in today's age, Sony has such a bad UI. This is the reason I would even consider returning it. 2. Playback volume is low however, if you play the recorded files on a PC (for example), it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: HonestOpinion

customer_reviews.title: As my Old Aunt and Uncle would say, what a Wonder !
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this is an advantage or a dis-advantage...I am old enough to remember my families first recording device in the late '50's'.. It was about 3ft X 2ft and the weight was about 30lb. Then in the mid to late 60's my cousin had a stereo recorder that weight was about 15lb and 2ft 1 ft. Then in the 70's the standard Panasonic cassette player, plastic 6 inches by 2. This little bugger is all of 4" long by 1.5" wide and does everything the others could not and with unlimited recording capability with recycling recording capability...I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald M. Craden

customer_reviews.title: Sony Recorder
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I have not used this recorder yet. I bought it to record sessions of a class that does not begin until next week. That being said, I put it together and have been practicing using it. It does not seem that difficult. One thing that seems disappointing: the instructions refer to auxiliary components that apparently do not come with the version distributed in USA. It would be nice to have the case, ear phones, a/c adapter and microphone referred to in the instructions. I guess that is the trade off for getting these features for this price.
customer_reviews.author: RGT

customer_reviews.title: Great for lecture
customer_reviews.text: Simpler than you'd imagine and came in great shape:) posted a few pics too. it also showed me I had 44 hours and 20 mins worth of time to record!
customer_reviews.author: Ektaa B.

customer_reviews.title: That's pretty helpful if you're driving
customer_reviews.text: Sure, you can use your phone to record your thoughts but I find this more convenient sometimes because I don't have to unlock a phone first. That's pretty helpful if you're driving. Some of the function lettering will wear with use, but by that time you will be so familiar with the device that it will hardly matter. I've never used it in a lecture setting, so I don't know its efficacy there. You could, I'm sure, attach a sensitive external mike to it and make out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dempsey Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse with great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a hardworking voice recorder; we have one of these at work that gets a heavy workout with public hearings and has never failed. The only complaint is the visibility of the text on the screen. Other than that, a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Klein

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: We use it to record Board of Director's Meetings for a Condo Association. Works perfectly. They used to use micro cassette tapes and store them. They rejected the idea of electronic storage of the meeting voice recordings at first as older folks tend to do but after a few uses they can't believe the ease of use when doing playback. I love not having to store and label all of those little tapes. Welcome us to 2015!
customer_reviews.author: audieace

customer_reviews.title: Great Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me after I had surgery and was learning to speak. I could hear how I sounded to others and worked on my pronunciation. My speech therapist also thought this was a good investment, and encouraged me to use it daily. My speech continues to improve with help of my recorder.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn m.

customer_reviews.title: Great for dictation and compatible with Dragon software
customer_reviews.text: Best digital recorder ever for the price. Easy to use. Small and compact that it fits in a breast pocket or pants pocket. I use this with a lapel mic and it pics it up fine. I bought this to use with Dragon software and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMae

customer_reviews.title: Very inadequate instructions. This unit will not work with ...
customer_reviews.text: Very inadequate instructions. This unit will not work with my cable connected phone system.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Snider

customer_reviews.title: It does the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: One hand without looking thanks to the design and layout of the keys. Great quality. And the Sony menus get easier to use with each iteration of the recorder. My only gripe is that it has only five folders and the week has seven days. Eight folders would be perfect; one for each day of the week and a spare for other stuff. Mounts on my desktop just fine so I can drag the files off. That makes the interface perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: this thing is awesome. I have a lecture class with 223 students
customer_reviews.text: Okay let me tell you what, do not be fooled by it small size, this thing is awesome. I have a lecture class with 223 students, the chairs are hecka squeaky, seriously whenever someone moves a little in their chair it makes a noise. Super annoying, yet this thing was still able to pick up my lecture professors voice. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie m

customer_reviews.title: Vastly inferior to its predecessor
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Sony ICD AX412 voice recorder for years for interviews, lectures and voice notes and I absolutely love it. Great sound quality, easy operation, etc. I wanted to get a back-up in case anything went wrong with it but Sony had already discontinued it so I tried the PX333. Unfortunately it is vastly inferior in every way. Feels chintzy, sound quality is poor, very hard to read the display because it is not backlit. I ended up paying a premium to buy another AX412 on eBay. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ahindes

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket recorder!.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second recorder. I carry it all of the time. The first one came with the Sound Organizer software which I still use. Sound Organizer software was not supplied with my second purchase. I would not have known what to do with my files, if I had not had the Sound Organizer. I wonder if it was an oversight. Without the software, I would not have used it nearly as much. .
customer_reviews.author: LRB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect voice recorder.
customer_reviews.text: You can use a phone app but I find that this one works better and the battery life is in the order of a weeks to months on one set of batteries. My cell phone won't last a day if I try to record with it all day. I have recorded an entire 3 day conference in an auditorium setting with good sound and hardly any drop in battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Voltronsbluelion

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, I bought one for my sister and ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this item for my lectures in school. I sit near the back of a moderate sized classroom and it can pick up every word the professor says and doesn't pick up too much ambient noise (I can occasionally hear the girls behind me talking, but the instructors voice overpowers theirs). Great purchase, I bought one for my sister and a friend attending college. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this...I've used it for Dr appointments mainly and keep it in my purse when it's recording and it will pick up the voices easily..It's easy to use & understand.. and trying to locate things you recorded are easy to find... . When listening to the playback, it's very clear and loud. There are no cons that I can think of.. It is perfect and performed way better than I expected..
customer_reviews.author: Nichole E.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every Penny Spent
customer_reviews.text: The perfect voice recorder for a home inspector. I carry this into the crawl spaces and attics where I cannot easily manage my note pad. Great voice sensitivity and playback clarity with easy-to-use presets and controls. The exterior case and controls seem very durable for the hard service I give this thing. Speaker size gives good playback volume. In sum, money well spent for a perfectly functioning tool I regularly use on my job.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.

customer_reviews.title: Used to be cheaper...Great Recorder but not worth over $100
customer_reviews.text: This was great. I LOVE this recorder. It has very a sensitive microphone that pics up anything- even through clothes if you wished to conceal it in a pocket. The expandable Micro SD card option works flawlessly too. I would give this a 5-Star review but I have to settle on 3 because of the price. In February 2016, I purchased this thing for about $42. I liked it so much, I wanted to purchase a second recorder. NOW THEY ARE $139?!?!? I don't understand AT ALL. This is the best recorder I have ever had. But it is NOT worth over $100. What is the deal Sony/Sellers?!?
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: Great little recorder
customer_reviews.text: Great little recorder. I just wish there were more instructions with it. Also would have been nice to include a cover. A friend bought a recorder that came with a cover, and it was less money than this one. I purchased a cover for it and use it for college lecture classes. It's perfect for that. It uses regular batteries, but I understand rechargeable batteries can be purchased for it. So far, I'm very happy with it. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mima

customer_reviews.title: Great Time-Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but my son REALLY likes it! I bought it for him so he wouldn't have to grab a pen and paper and try to write while he's driving. He dictates a lot of information into it and uploads to his laptop. It's a tremendous time saver, and helps him to remember many things which might have otherwise been forgotten.
customer_reviews.author: spaceman

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Functions are as expected. Perfect for lectures. I've had absolutely no problems whatsoever. I was nervous about the negative reviews but it works like a charm. Very useful. Everything works. Definitely recommend if you're in the market for a recorder. Alot of people in my nursing classes have this exact recorder.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: As a pre-nursing student all my brainpower is used somedays on homework, quizzes, and lab practicals. This thing is stupid-easy to use, and helps with the knowledge that I have the recorded lecture for when my notes don't quite match the questions on the homework. The noise cancellation doesn't work as well in the auditoriums but as long as your prof doesn't mind it on the podium it records loud and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: I like the software and the capacity of the device
customer_reviews.text: I like the software and the capacity of the device. Battery usage is very minimal. The only downside is a difficult to read screen, especially in shadows or at night, when it is near impossible. Otherwise, I am satisfied with the quality. I suggest you also purchase the ECMCS3 microphone if you are using for interviews and other voice activities. It's a big improvement over the built in mic.
customer_reviews.author: DEM2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for notes to self, notes to others, and making sure what happend is what you were lead to believe!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for notes to self, used for much more, great voice activation, voice sensitivity, recording time, and text conversion through windows....records beautifully in a class room, traveling in a car, sitting in the kitchen, living room, or a kids room! Small enough to place conveniently, feature and quality rich enough to get useful recordings almost anywhere!
customer_reviews.author: William Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Sony and a much cheaper recovered. The cheaper one didn't compare. Although would quality is good for both, what made me choose the Sony was its ease of use. The buttons are clear and the functions are easy to use. Some have so many features, that I'd probably never use it makes it convoluted. Buy Sony. It's worthy the extra money. Oh and it feels sturdy. I'm going to use this for a few years and I want it to last. This feels like it will
customer_reviews.author: Eden's mom

customer_reviews.title: Good value, reliable digital recorder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a Wonderful little GIZMO that is way to operate and it picks up sound clearly for taping a seminar. I have not yet used all of the functions, but I recommend getting one that you can plug into you computer. You can then upload the taped material into iTunes..like automatically and from there share by putting the Mp3 in the dropbox. I needed the seminar transcribed. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: patricia fero

customer_reviews.title: As seen on TV!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, I've seen this item on TV. I use this mostly for school but recently took on a new job. My boss was ok with me recording the information which has been incredibly helpful when learning the ropes. It's also great for recording family stories so you can transcribe them. I'm only giving it 4 stars because I think the software to listen to the recordings could be improved and that the playback volume on the recorder could be better.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: love it, i'm using it to record classes in ...
customer_reviews.text: love it, i'm using it to record classes in my college. but you need to put it in the professor's table to get a clear sound, not because the sound doesn't reach but the sound of you flipping papers and other people talking will be recorded over his/her voice/sound if it was on your desk/table.
customer_reviews.author: amin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and so loud with clarity! I'm so excited to use this recorder for class.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Great little recorder
customer_reviews.text: This recorder works great and its very easy to use. I got it to record our church sermons. The pastor simply has to hit record and when done I just transfer the files to my computer and upload them to a podcast.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Lara

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
customer_reviews.text: My camera for church videos did not pick up very good audio at all. I looked into getting a Zoom hand held recorder, but they were pretty pricey. I came around to this one because of the price, and because I saw a video using it in action on YouTube. Have been very impressed. There are several settings, and just make sure you put it on the right setting for your project.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Would frecommend
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Only thing I would change is the on and off button and remove the hold that is in the slide button to turn off and on as there is no reason to have it there other than make it more confusing to turn it off and on. But otherwise it is a good product with good software.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie

customer_reviews.title: Nice little recorder!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I bought this recorder to capture random thoughts and childhood memories. The folders allow me to keep things separated into the various stages of my life. Since I don't know how I sound to others, I had my daughter listen to one recorded segment. She says it sounds exactly like me. I have not yet downloaded full instructions to my computer but am finding it very easy to access everything I need using the quick start guide.
customer_reviews.author: GinnieBee

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this recorder to audition for voice overs, but there is too much hissing noise in the background. I don't know why there are so many great reviews about this product. It has more background noise than other Sony recorders.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for college students!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this voice recorder for an especially tough quarter at school. Microbiology PLUS Pharmacology together. I'm able to record the lectures, and go back later to take better notes than I'm able to in class. So far this has been so helpful in sorting out these lectures and hearing things I missed during the initial class period. Very satisfied with this! Best money I've spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Kibbles_and_Pitbulls

customer_reviews.title: ... to record a convention and it pick up everything nice and clear
customer_reviews.text: Used it to record a convention and it pick up everything nice and clear. If you buy a lapel microphone you can hook it up to the recorder and have great audio for videos or voice overs. Worked as intended. Solid piece of equipment. Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Practice buddy
customer_reviews.text: I use this to record myself when practicing my music. It's very simple to use and there is virtually no setup necessary. I can practice whatever piece I am working on and play it back immediately and critique my practice. I play in three distinctively different musical groups and I feel using this for practice has made my practice sessions much more beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F

customer_reviews.title: great recorder, downside takes batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing, to use recorder, i paired this with the sony ecmcs3 clip omnidirectional stero microphone and its awesome. I use it for videos, My only major complaint is I WISH IT WAS RECHARGABLE, but it takes BATTERIES :/
customer_reviews.author: armando from CA

customer_reviews.title: So I moved the recorder to the professor's podium and it worked much better. It is easy to use and the batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it in college to tape the lectures. When I first used it, I set it at the corner of my desk, but it picked up the sound when I turned the pages. So I moved the recorder to the professor's podium and it worked much better. It is easy to use and the batteries last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Love this recorder
customer_reviews.text: Love this recorder. I have used it in a hill for the past week or so and fell in love. It's easy to use and recordings sound wonderful even from 10ft away. I love that fact I can switch folders for the call I am in. Plus you can download it to your computer and also add more storage. Recommend to anyone who is in school or who just needs something to records your voice.
customer_reviews.author: soccergirl2150

customer_reviews.title: It comes with a cable so you can easily upload audio to your computer as well
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very simple to use and understand. The sound quality is impressive too. It comes with a cable so you can easily upload audio to your computer as well. And as a plus it has a slot for SD card for extra storage space. I can't imagine needing anything more than this. It's great. Do buy
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Great but not excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to record interviews in a small office. Works perfectly- audio quality is quite good and very intelligible. Knocking off a point because the interface is a bit annoying - having said that, it didn't give me any trouble either. If you need something to use everyday in a variety of scenarios I met get the next model up - but this one is fine if you learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for anyone that has to take minutes at meetings. It helps to go back over conversations later, for verification. Great little recording device, and can really pick up conversation, even from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Mingle

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and weight. Works well and is very clear in playback. Instructions not very good and it takes a while to get it. But once that is over unit is great, Have not tried in a lecture hall yet but I anticipate it will be OK
customer_reviews.author: D Phillips

customer_reviews.title: handy and works great
customer_reviews.text: This handy little recorder slips into a pocket so is easy to carry along for just about any reason. I use it to record bird song, later using the recordings back at home to help me identify the songster. I had my last one for years, until I stuck it in a sock and lost it somewhere outside so I had to get a new one. Couldn't stand to be without it for long!
customer_reviews.author: Toree

customer_reviews.title: ) and it picked up the sound beautifully. I set it on low (2 or 3) ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as advertised. Bought this for college lectures (which it has a setting for!) and it picked up the sound beautifully. I set it on low (2 or 3) volume, hit record, then turn up the volume when playing back. Nice and clear. I also like that you can save in different files and upload onto your computer. It does scratch easily (dropped it once while walking back to my car), but it doesn't affect the sound so who cares. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lady 45

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Device is working well. Seems to have a good battery life and records well with the built in mic. I like the idea that I can replace the batteries instead of having to plug it into the computer to charge. Connects to my computer running Linux and I can copy files with no problem. Seems to be a quality device.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Litzelman

customer_reviews.title: Great little recorder
customer_reviews.text: I love this recorder. It's very easy to use. The batteries last forever. It's a voice recorder and I got it to record music workshops with 20 or more people in the room, all with an instrument. I was really surprised at how good the recording quality is. It's also really easy to load the recordings to my computer. The Sound Organizer onscreen Quick Operation Guide is among the best I've ever seen. It quickly walks you thru an operation with pictures and words.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Great digital recorder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little digital recorder that works great for recording my professors' lectures. When I play the recordings back, the quality is like I back in class hearing the lecture. I liked this so much that I purchased another for my son to record his classes.
customer_reviews.author: Erynn Bauer

product_meta.title: SONY ICD PX333 Digital Voice Recorder
product_meta.description: 4GB Internal Flash Memory microSD Expansion Memory Slot Records Mono MP3s Intelligent Noise Cut A-B Repeat Function Track Mark Function USB Cable to Transfer Files to Mac/PC Includes 2 AAA Batteries
feature_bullets: 4GB Internal Flash Memory, Requires 2 AAA Batteries
microSD Expansion Memory Slot, Records Mono MP3s
Intelligent Noise Cut, A-B Repeat Function
Track Mark Function, USB Cable to Transfer Files to Mac/PC
System Requirements: Windows XP (SP3), Vista (SP2), 7, 8 Mac OS X 10.3.9 to 10.8

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,551 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
